meanings.definition: A spot or stain, especially of ink or paint.
meanings.sent1: The teacher noticed a few blots on the student's paper.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally spilled ink, creating blots on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The blots on the puppy's fur made it look like a little artist.
meanings.sent4: The blots of color on the canvas formed a beautiful abstract painting.
meanings.sent5: The blots on the map indicated the locations of important landmarks.

meanings.definition: To mark or stain with spots or smears.
meanings.sent1: He blots his shirt with ketchup every time he eats a burger.
meanings.sent2: The rain began to fall, threatening to blot the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to blot his sister's face with a marker.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to blot out the sun, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee started to blot the pages of the open book.

meanings.definition: To remove or obliterate something unwanted or incorrect.
meanings.sent1: She used a tissue to blot the excess oil from her face.
meanings.sent2: The eraser can easily blot out any mistakes you make on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand, trying to blot out the embarrassing memory.
meanings.sent4: The loud music seemed to blot out all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright light from the lamp blotted out the stars in the night sky.
